dcterms:creator: T. Lykouris
V. Mirrokni
R. Paes Leme
dcterms:description: This dataset extends the model of stochastic bandits with adversarial corruption to the stochastic linear optimization problem, providing an algorithm that is agnostic to the amount of corruption chosen by the adaptive adversary.
dcterms:title: Stochastic Linear Optimization with Adversarial Corruption

dcterms:creator: V. Dani
T. P. Hayes
S. M. Kakade
dcterms:description: This dataset addresses the stochastic linear optimization problem under bandit feedback, providing foundational algorithms for the study of bandit problems.
dcterms:title: Stochastic Linear Optimization Problem

dcterms:creator: Y. Abbasi-Yadkori
D. Pál
C. Szepesvári
dcterms:description: This dataset includes improved algorithms for linear stochastic bandits, focusing on the exploration-exploitation trade-off in multi-armed bandit settings.
dcterms:title: Linear Stochastic Bandits

dcterms:creator: A. Beygelzimer
J. Langford
L. Li
L. Reyzin
R. Schapire
dcterms:description: This dataset presents contextual bandit algorithms that come with supervised learning guarantees, enhancing the understanding of contextual bandit problems.
dcterms:title: Contextual Bandit Algorithms

dcterms:creator: S. Kapoor
K. K. Patel
P. Kar
dcterms:description: This dataset focuses on corruption-tolerant bandit learning, addressing the challenges posed by adversarial corruption in bandit settings.
dcterms:title: Corruption-Tolerant Bandit Learning

dcterms:creator: P. Auer
dcterms:description: This dataset introduces the finite-armed version of the stochastic linear optimization problem, providing insights into the exploration-exploitation trade-offs.
dcterms:title: Finite-Armed Version of the Stochastic Linear Optimization Problem

dcterms:creator: S. Bubeck
A. Slivkins
dcterms:description: This dataset explores the intersection of stochastic and adversarial bandits, providing algorithms that perform well in both settings.
dcterms:title: The Best of Both Worlds: Stochastic and Adversarial Bandits

dcterms:creator: J. Zimmert
Y. Seldin
dcterms:description: This dataset presents an optimal algorithm for stochastic and adversarial bandits, contributing to the understanding of regret bounds in these settings.
dcterms:title: An Optimal Algorithm for Stochastic and Adversarial Bandits
